intro: Arthrocarpum, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, often lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically tubular or bell-shaped, with five lobes, and are usually pink or yellow in color. Arthrocarpum species are native to regions of southern Africa and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. These plants are adapted to arid environments and can withstand periods of drought.
